body:
Making use of size hints enables *much* faster sampling for large iterators. Might I suggest that if you want more predictable behaviour you use `SliceRandom::choose`?

Perhaps we should explicitly document that `size_hint` affects sampling behaviour and not just performance. Sorry, I thought this would be obvious.

I understand that it provides much faster sampling and it does make sense to have this option available. However it should be explicitly called out in the documentation and there should be an option provided that doesn't have this optimization. I think that using a PRNG is a common use case, especially for tests and people may be surprised when they are getting different results for a change that looks like it should be a no-op.

> Might I suggest that if you want more predictable behaviour you use SliceRandom::choose?

This is often a good option however in some cases materializing the whole iterator is not desired.

repository.name: rand
repository.description: A Rust library for random number generation.

body: I think documenting the behavior is the best way forward (see #1052 for my attempt). I don't really see a strong motivation for providing a stable alternative implementation. As far as I can see, the only use case with somewhat surprising behavior are noop iterator combinators, which seems like an extreme edge case.

I don't see how this is an extreme edge case. This affects any function that tries to use this function on an interator from an unknown source. Whether or not the difference matters depends on the application.
I still can't think of an application, but I guess we could add `IteratorRandom::choose_stable`. @dhardy What do you think?

In my example I have composible filters and rankers. Most of them fall back to a random selector if they can't narrow it down to one choice. However it is surprising when you have a filter that shouldn't have an effect do something. For example:

- Adding a filter that logically shouldn't change anything due to known state or being less selective than previous filters. 
- A debugging filter that collects the iterator in order to make more intelligent printing decisions, then forwards the `Vec.into_iter()`. 

It also means that seemingly noop changes such as refactoring to avoid collecting the iterator will change the result which makes it harder to validate that the change is correct.
If this method would be accepted I can write it.
Yes, I guess we can accept `choose_stable`.
That PR only updated documentation so not done yet.
Thanks, I'll hopefully have time to make a PR soon.

issue.title: Add Iterator::choose_stable()

repository.name: rand
repository.description: A Rust library for random number generation.

issue.body:
This function is similar to Iterator::choose() except that given a PRNG and any iterator of the same length it will always select the same element and make the same calls to the PRNG.

Closes https://github.com/rust-random/rand/issues/1051
